title: What Robert Spillane and Harold Landry said about their injury statuses
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Harold Landry missed the AFC Championship game due to a knee injury but plans to play in the Super Bowl.
Robert Spillane suffered an ankle injury in the AFC Championship and is taking steps to play in the Super Bowl.
Both Landry and Spillane were listed as questionable, but are optimistic about their participation in the Super Bowl.

title: Hundreds of apartments proposed for former Weylu’s site
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Developers propose a 300-unit rental complex on the former Weylu's site on Route 1, Saugus.
Saugus exceeds 10% affordable housing, potentially triggering Safe Harbor to block the development.
Residents express concerns over traffic and historic home impacts from the proposed project.

title: Ski Etiquette 101: What are your top do’s and don’ts for skiers and riders?
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Blue Hills Ski Area in Canton sees heavy activity as New England's ski season is underway.
National Ski Areas Association recommends a 10-point safety guide for skiers and snowboarders.
Common etiquette issues include chairlift bar use, littering, and table hogging in lodge areas.

title: PETA sues over Mass. wiretap laws, saying they impede animal cruelty investigations
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: PETA filed a lawsuit against Massachusetts' wiretap laws, arguing they obstruct investigations into animal cruelty.
Massachusetts requires all-party consent for recording conversations, unlike most states where only one party's consent is needed.
PETA seeks an exemption to conduct undercover investigations without legal repercussions for recording abuse incidents.

title: Ben Affleck teases Dunkin’ Super Bowl commercial with stars of ‘Seinfeld,’ ‘Friends’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Ben Affleck stars in Dunkin' 2026 Super Bowl commercial with Jennifer Aniston, Jason Alexander, and Matt LeBlanc.
The teaser features a '90s-themed VHS tape labeled 'Network Pilot '95 v3' described as 'monstah cringe.'
This is the fourth year Affleck and Artists Equity are producing Dunkin' ads for Super Bowl audiences.

title: All the new movies and TV shows streaming in February
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Romantic films see a surge on streaming platforms in February 2026 for Valentine's Day, featuring classics like 'You’ve Got Mail' on Netflix.
In honor of Black History Month, films by Black directors such as 'Malcolm X' on HBO Max are available to stream.
2025 films debuting on streaming include 'Kiss of the Spider Woman' on Hulu and 'Splitsville' on Hulu, starting February 6.

title: Here’s how much a gig worker makes in Somerville
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: C.B., a 52-year-old gig worker in Somerville, earns $22,000 annually after business expenses.
C.B. manages multiple part-time gigs including dog walking, research consulting, and property management.
Living frugally with roommates, C.B. avoids major expenses by subletting and minimizing lifestyle costs.

title: More Harvard connections to Epstein revealed in newly released documents
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Harvard physics professor Lisa Randall exchanged emails and flew on Jeffrey Epstein's private jet after his 2008 conviction.
Harvard Hillel solicited donations from Epstein for years, even after his guilty plea for soliciting prostitution from a minor.
Harvard received $9 million from Epstein over a decade; Harvard Hillel has since updated its fundraising guidelines.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about ‘the potential for record-breaking cold’ this weekend
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Wind chills in Boston may drop to -15° to -25° by Sunday morning due to gusty winds.
National Weather Service warns of dangerously low wind chills this weekend, with an Arctic surge bringing record-breaking cold.
Light snow expected Friday night into Saturday, followed by Arctic air with very dry conditions and strong winds.

title: WBZ’s Steve Burton shared a ‘humbling moment’ during Super Bowl week, and people loved it
author: John Waller
bullets: Steve Burton shared a photo of his daughter Veronica Burton on a billboard during Super Bowl week in the Bay Area.
Veronica Burton, a WNBA player, was the No. 7 overall pick in the 2002 draft and earned the Most Improved Player Award.
WBZ-TV producer Joe Giza captured a woman calling Steve Burton 'Veronica's dad,' highlighting her growing popularity.
